Name: In-Seine
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered white grapes.
STRAIN into ice-filled glass (preferably over a large cube or chunk of block ice).
Review: Elderflower liqueur mellows and boosts the brandy's floral notes, while dashes of absinthe balance sweetness and add aniseed notes.
History: Created in 2006 by yours truly at The Cabinet Room, London, England. The name is a reference to the Parisian district of St-Germain, lying on the left bank of the River Seine, and a nod to the use of absinthe and its pre-war ban in France partly due to the belief that it induced insanity.
Nutrition: One serving of In-Seine contains 221 calories
